page.title: 02Easinton Village
page.content: The name Easington is Saxon in origin and appeared as either Esinton, Esyngtona or Esingtune meaning the village of Essingas. It is situated two miles from the north east coast. The village is one of the oldest in County Durham firstmentioned in 900 AD. It is an interesting place and it has two special features, the church and an old mill. The church is facing the green. The mill is near the motorway and is owned by the Hunters. The area around Easington is rural. The A19 road from Sunderland to Middlesborough passes on the west of the village.
